parts.name: aorta
parts.intro: This is a diagram of the excretory system.
parts.explanation: The aorta is the largest artery in the body. It carries oxygen-rich blood from the heart to all parts of the body, including the kidneys.

parts.name: vena cava
parts.explanation: The vena cava is a large vein that carries deoxygenated blood from the body back to the heart. The inferior vena cava brings blood from the lower body.

parts.name: renal artery
parts.explanation: The renal artery carries blood from the aorta to the kidneys. This blood contains waste products that the kidneys will filter out.

parts.name: kidney
parts.explanation: The kidneys are bean-shaped organs that filter waste products and extra water from the blood to make urine. You have two kidneys, one on each side of your spine.

parts.name: renal vein
parts.explanation: The renal vein carries filtered blood away from the kidneys and back to the heart. This blood has had waste products removed by the kidneys.

parts.name: ureter
parts.explanation: The ureter is a tube that carries urine from the kidneys down to the bladder. There is one ureter for each kidney.

parts.name: bladder
parts.explanation: The bladder is a muscular sac that stores urine until you are ready to go to the bathroom. It can expand to hold urine and contracts to push it out.

parts.name: urethra
parts.explanation: The urethra is the tube that carries urine from the bladder out of the body. This is how urine leaves your body when you go to the bathroom.
